com.analog.lyric.dimple.events

Interface IDimpleEventHandler<Event extends DimpleEvent>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DimpleEventBlocker, DimpleEventHandler, EventPrinter

    public interface IDimpleEventHandler<Event extends DimpleEvent>
    Abstract interface for dimple event handlers.

    Most implementors will simply want to extend DimpleEventHandler.

    Since:
    0.06

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handleEvent(Event event)
      Takes an action in response to given event.
      boolean isBlocker()
      True if handler does nothing other than to consume the event.

    • Method Detail

      • handleEvent

        void handleEvent(Event event)
        Takes an action in response to given event.

        Multiple event handlers may respond to the same event. Setting DimpleEvent.consumed(boolean) to true will prevent any handlers after this one from being notified of the event (the handler is not expected to check to see if an event has already been consumed).

        The handler does not necessarily have to be able to handle all subtypes of the Event type, only those that it was explicitly registered for with a DimpleEventListener.

        Parameters:
        event - may not be null.
        Since:
        0.06

      • isBlocker

        boolean isBlocker()
        True if handler does nothing other than to consume the event.

        Only true for DimpleEventBlocker.

        Since:
        0.06
        See Also:
        DimpleEventBlocker
